fight somebody/something ↔ off.translati: to keep someone away, or stop them doing something to you, by fighting or opposing them
Bodyguards had to fight off the crowds.
The company managed to fight off a takeover attempt.
to succeed in stopping other people getting something, and to get it for yourself
Allan fought off stiff competition from throughout the UK to win one of only four places at the college.
to try hard to get rid of something, especially an illness or a feeling
